facts: Moses led the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt, and the Bible says God gave him the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai.
David started as a young shepherd and later became king of Israel after defeating the giant Goliath with a sling and stone.
Esther was a Jewish queen in Persia who bravely spoke up to help save her people from danger.
Daniel was taken to Babylon as a captive, yet he stayed faithful to God and survived being thrown into a lions’ den.
Ruth showed loyalty by choosing to stay with her mother-in-law Naomi, and she became an ancestor of King David.
Peter was a fisherman who became one of Jesus’ closest disciples and is known for boldly sharing the Christian message after Jesus’ resurrection.
Paul, once known as Saul, changed from persecuting Christians to becoming a major missionary who wrote many letters in the New Testament.
sources_hint: Use a standard Bible translation such as NIV, ESV, or KJV, especially Exodus 1–20; 1 Samuel 16–17; Esther; Daniel 6; Ruth; the Gospels; and Acts plus Paul’s epistles.
